item.title: Welcome
item.description: Hello there, I put random thoughts here in an effort to test out Working in Public.

item.title: Brandon Boswell Year in Review
item.description: His 2022 Year in review Something about this spoke to me when I saw it. As time goes on you’ll forget much of a year. I like the idea of aggregating at multiple levels.

item.title: Weekly
item.description: Two parts Review Many of my practices are on the weekly cadence. Each has a goal in mind and this review session is the cue for those tasks to be done I do my Weekly planning on Sunday mornings.

item.title: Spaced Repetition System
item.description: What am I doing with this? What I use this for is effectively my takeaways. Things that resonate with me. Ah Ha moments or key insights and learnings that I want to recall the specifics of so that they are committed to memory.

item.title: New Year's Resolutions
item.description: 90% socially acceptable lying to oneself by using over sized cadences to create a Bystander Effect with future versions of oneself.

item.title: The Way I Work v2
item.description: Background The purpose of “the way I work” series of writing is to track what my process actually is. Personally I use it as a bit of an audit. My workflow goes through expansions and contractions naturally.

item.title: Testing a sample publish page
item.description: Summary This will be deleted after successful deploy Body.

item.title: Capture
item.description: What? Capture for me is making sure that all ideas and requests go to one place so that I can process them at one time. From there they go to die. Few will survive and live on to the done column.

item.title: Future
item.description: I like to map out my view of the future. A bit of a map of my current view of the future. I don’t call it a 5 year plan because I have no clue how far off it is.

item.title: Yearly
item.description: I don’t do much work on a yearly cadence. I find things like New Year’s Resolutions to be generally ineffective. Instead I use this as a social queue to sum up the year and take a step back to appreciate the progress I’ve made.
